entities.name: BROTHERS GRIMM
entities.description: Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm, German brothers and scholars who collected and published fairy tales in the early 19th century

entities.name: JACOB GRIMM
entities.description: One of the two brothers who collected and published fairy tales, known for his work with his brother Wilhelm

entities.name: WILHELM GRIMM
entities.description: One of the two brothers who collected and published fairy tales, known for his work with his brother Jacob

entities.name: GERMANY
entities.description: Country where the Brothers Grimm collected and published their famous fairy tales

entities.name: CINDERELLA
entities.description: A famous fairytale about a young girl who is mistreated by her stepfamily but eventually marries a prince with the help of a fairy godmother

entities.name: RHODOPIS
entities.description: A character from an ancient Greek story, considered one of the earliest versions of Cinderella

entities.name: CHARLES PERRAULT
entities.description: French author who published a version of Cinderella in 1697, introducing iconic elements such as the fairy godmother and the glass slipper

entities.name: SNOW WHITE
entities.description: A famous fairytale about a beautiful princess who escapes her wicked stepmother and finds refuge with seven dwarfs

entities.name: HANSEL AND GRETEL
entities.description: A famous fairytale about two siblings who are abandoned in the woods and outsmart a cannibalistic witch

entities.name: BEAUTY AND THE BEAST
entities.description: A famous fairytale about a young woman who sees beyond the beastly exterior of a cursed prince to discover his true nature

entities.name: PYGMALION AND GALATEA
entities.description: An ancient Roman myth about a sculptor who falls in love with his creation, a statue that comes to life

entities.name: OVID
entities.description: Roman poet who wrote about the myth of Pygmalion and Galatea, one of the earliest known versions of the Beauty and the Beast story

entities.name: ANCIENT MYTHS
entities.description: A category of stories that have been retold in different forms throughout history, including the myth of Pygmalion and Galatea

entities.name: EUROPEAN FOLKLORE
entities.description: A body of traditional stories and legends from Europe, including tales similar to Hansel and Gretel

entities.name: GERMAN FOLKLORE
entities.description: A body of traditional stories and legends from Germany, including variations of Snow White

entities.name: ITALIAN FOLKLORE
entities.description: A body of traditional stories and legends from Italy, including variations of Snow White

entities.name: SLAVIC FOLKLORE
entities.description: A body of traditional stories and legends from Slavic cultures, including variations of Snow White

entities.name: ORAL TRADITIONS
entities.description: The practice of passing down stories and cultural knowledge through spoken word, which played a significant role in the preservation of fairytales

entities.name: EARLY 19TH CENTURY
entities.description: The time period when the Brothers Grimm began collecting and publishing fairy tales
The year Charles Perrault published his version of Cinderella
